metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25721 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Kerberos acceptors need easy access to stable AD identifiers (eg objectSid). Samba as an AD DC now provides a way for Linux applications to obtain a reliable SID (and samAccountName) in issued tickets.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-25721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libsmbclient - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
python3-samba - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
registry-tools - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-common - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-libs - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
smbclient - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
winbind - 2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Fixing this in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS would require substantial code backports. We will not be fixing this issue in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS. In environments where this is of concern, we recommend updating to a more recent Ubuntu version.

criterions.comment: samba package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.13.14+dfsg-0ubuntu0.21.10.1').
